page.title: 17INDUSTRY
page.content: On the Aughrim Road there is a small industrial estate consisting of five factories.They are E.P. Manco,Peter England,Centretile,Express Parts and Indicators International L.T.D. {Peter England}moved from Station Road in 1963.James Burnside founded this shirt-making factory in Station Road until it was necessary to move to Aughrim Road.The current workforce is 468 and it is now one of the most up to date factories in Europe. {E.P.Manco}and {Express Parts}share a factory which opened in 1980.Express Parts make road signs and E.P. Manco produces protective clothing.Between they employ ten workers.{Centretile} which opened in 1978 employs seven men making terrazzo tiles.{Indicators {International}which opened in 1968 currently employs 24 people making destination indicators for buses.
